data.text: @guardian Terry's story is sad, but keep in mind that his story is also being published by feminists to weaken the image of men. And it's being used by white men [the ones who are intimidated by masculine black men] to feminize the image of black men. Nevertheless, his story is important.
@guardian Way different than woman being strong armed by a man twice her weight, forced into unthinkable https://t.co/Y020JzX9uD can defend yourself.
@Ducksess @guardian Sadly, it's not always that easy... 😑
@Ducksess @guardian in powerful position & the victim don't speak nor act the way he thought have done bcoz he thinks nobody will believe him or stand by him.
@Ducksess @guardian Many men think they would do that. Some will. But despite their manhood, some will stay stupefy & don't respond. Often, the aggressor is
@guardian Many more to come !   Let's hope it starts the ball rolling in TV and music in this Country too ! Raising massive awareness of CSA
@leoxymoron @guardian On both sides. But point definitely taken. We often speak of sexual assault as if only against women and men often abused too.
@guardian It takes real courage to talk about sexual assault being a man. 👏
@guardian So to hear what happened to you Terry and your family.. I would of stomped the SOB and gone to jail.. just sayin..

@guardian Don't wish to belittle the subject, but:
The exec who did that - must have been completely inebriated, Terry is HUGE...
@guardian Wow... I stand with all victims of sexual assault and harassment and I applaud their courage and most importantly I believe them.
@guardian if any man groped my sausage and peas i would chop his hands off.
